w:r.w:t: Deliverables Completed Since Last Review and Feedback Closure (25%)
What was committed during the previous review
Clear evidence of implementation (code, logs, hardware demo, experiments, updated documentation)
Whether any scope changes were justified
Focus: Measurable progress compared to promised progress.
Evaluate the depth and maturity of technical work completed so far.
Focus: Substantial working technical progress, not theoretical explanation.
Code structure / firmware organization / model clarity
Use of proper engineering practices (version control, modularity, testing, experiment tracking)
Focus: Engineering discipline, maintainability, and technical professionalism.
Use of real data or real hardware
Measurable outputs (metrics, results, observable system behavior)
Level of completeness of the prototype
Focus: Project planning maturity and feasibility awareness.
Clear ownership of specific modules or components
Alignment between claimed work and demonstrated contribution
Focus: Accountability and fairness within the team.
FINAL YEAR PROJECT PROGRESS REVIEW REPORT
a) List the deliverables that were committed during the previous review.
Current status (Completed / Partially Completed / Not Started)
Clear evidence of work (repository activity, demo reference, hardware validation,
If incomplete, explain the reason and corrective action taken
) Estimate the percentage of the previously planned milestone that is now complete.
2. Technical Implementation and Iteration Since Last Review
a) Describe the technical components implemented since the previous review.
Explain any key technical iterations or design changes:
Provide measurable technical evidence where applicable:
3. Current Working State of the Project
a) Describe the current working prototype or system state.
b) What functionality can be demonstrated live at this stage?
c) What remains incomplete, unstable, or under development?
d) What are the most significant technical challenges currently faced?
a) Summarize the major feedback points received in the last review.
b) Clearly explain how each feedback point has been addressed.
c) If any feedback was not implemented, justify the reason.
Specific technical work completed since last review:
a) List the remaining major tasks required for project completion.
b) Provide an updated timeline to completion.
c) Identify current technical or project risks and proposed mitigation strategies.
d) State whether the project is on track relative to the original plan.
If not, explain deviations and corrective measures.
